title: In defence of diesel: the argument in favour of diesel cars (and the models to buy now)
text:
Diesel has been vilified of late. It’s seen as dirty, polluting, and the kind of stuff you’d only use if your hobbies include witchcraft and drowning puppies. Way back when, though diesel cars and fuel was more expensive, diesels were cheaper to tax and higher MPG figures made them appealing to run, seen as a cleaner alternative to pretty much everything. This is no longer the case.

While the follies of engineers told to find ways to meet ever stricter emissions targets landed diesel in the faeces a few years ago, what’s come out the other side isn’t necessarily the evil you’d expect.
